alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; South Central Mountains; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 22 at 9:38AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and west central New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, South Central Mountains. In north central New Mexico, Jemez Mountains. In west central New Mexico, Southwest Mountains. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall may lead to excessive runoff over recent wildfire burn scars such as the Cerro Pelado, Bear Trap, McBride, and Black scars. Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Wildfire burn scars and areas that received heavy rainfall on Thursday will be especially vulnerable to excessive runoff and flash flooding. - https://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; South Central Mountains; Southwest Mountains
